sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says he won't bow to international pressure to cancel action in Rafah, as this would be the same as losing the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russian officials say the cause of Alexei Navalny's death is being re-examined, as arrests at memorials across Russia surpass 400.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Josep Borre said the EU will not be able to play a geopolitical role if it is not ready to defend itself during the annual Munich security conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At least 40 people are reported to have been killed after a series of Israeli airstrikes in the Deir al-Bala neighborhood in central Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As Israel Defense Forces said it struck a series of Hamas operational command and control centers there, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reiterated that he won't bow to international pressure to cancel the planned operation in Rafah, as this would be the same as losing the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Israel, on my behalf, will continue to resist with a strong one-sided recognition in the Palestinian state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And when do we want to give the one-sided recognition in the Palestinian state. And when do you want to give this one-sided recognition?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After the terrible blow of the 7th in October, there cannot be a greater price for terror." Netanyahu's government is under increasing pressure from both abroad and inside the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands of protesters came out to a weekly march in Tel Aviv, with demands to replace the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Protesters believe the goal of liberating detainees is far from being fulfilled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One woman was killed and five people injured after Russian bombs struck a residential neighborhood in Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As Russian forces carried out several airstrikes on Saturday in eastern Ukraine, U.S. President Joe Biden said he was confident that additional funding for Ukrainian forces will ultimately be approved by the U.S. Congress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The idea that we're going to walk away from Ukraine, the idea that we're going to let NATO begin to split, is totally against the interests of the United States of America and it is against our word we've given so much sense all the way back to Eisenhower.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But Biden admitted he wasn't confident the funding would come through before Ukraine loses more territory. Lack of U.S. aid is believed to be one of the reasons the town of Avdivka was lost, according to media and experts. Howitzer artillery weapons have been mostly silent over the last weeks to conserve ammunition, according to Latvian journalists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russian officials say the cause of Alexei Navalny's death has not yet been established and that his body would not be released until next week when the results of a new investigation were complete.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Navalny's mother spent all of Saturday trying to recover her son's body, but in vain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At the remote Arctic penal colony where he was being held, she was told that his body had been moved to a morgue in Salkhad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the morgue was closed and staff denied that they had ever had the body.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Supporters of the politician say Russian authorities are trying to cover up potential foul play.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile arrests continue as Russians came to lay flowers at memorials to Navalny.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to a group that monitors political repression in Russia, more than four people have been detained at memorial events since his death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Despite some detainees being released shortly after, courts have started to pronounce arrests for organising a mass event in violation of public order or resisting police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The European Union's foreign policy chief, Joseph Boré, said that the bloc will not be able to play a geopolitical role if it is not ready to defend itself on the final day of the annual

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Munich security conference. Concerning Ukraine, he stressed that the member states need to work together quicker and better. We have been hesitating maybe too much, too many times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Two years ago, here, we were ready to give helmets. Now we are giving F-16, Then we were ready to give helmets. Now we are giving F-16s, but two years later.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Had we taken this decision quicker, maybe the war would have been different.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Speaking of the Israel-Hamas war, Boré said the EU needs to be more united if it wants a role in the Middle East.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Quoting, as we have been in the case of Ukraine, where with maybe the exception of a single country, our unity has been remarkable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But here I see that there is dispersion of approaches and many member states want to play their own game.
